byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: Japanese press warns Brit control bases in East might lead to trouble
snippet: TOKYO, March 1--A message to the Hochi Shimbun from Vladivostok states that the Soviet Far Eastern Fleet may in the future escort Russian merchantmen in Far Eastern waters unless the British release the steamer Serenga, recently seized and taken t...

headline.main: SOVIET REPORTED PLANNING CONVOYS; Japan Hears Warships May Guard Freighters Unless British Free Serenga EXTENSION OF WAR FEARED Tokyo Warns Establishment of Control Bases in East Might Lead to Trouble

lead_paragraph: TOKYO, March 1--A message to the Hochi Shimbun from Vladivostok states that the Soviet Far Eastern Fleet may in the future escort Russian merchantmen in Far Eastern waters unless the British release the steamer Serenga, recently seized and taken to Hong Kong while carrying tungsten and antimony from Vladivostok consigned to Germany.
